slides.title: Real-time prompt filtering
slides.description: Detects sensitive info such as names, phone numbers, and account numbers in real time and pseudonymizes automatically to prevent leakage. All personal data is safely protected without users even noticing.

slides.title: Sensitive info detection in documents
slides.description: Detects sensitive info in uploaded/attached documents in real time and automatically pseudonymizes or masks them. AI securely manages even hidden personal data across massive documents.

slides.title: Context-aware detection
slides.description: Understands contextual meaning beyond words to detect intelligently. Protects not only personal data but also company/industry-specific critical information.

slides.title: ON-PREMISE independent operation
slides.description: Can be fully installed within the intranet without external clouds for safer use, perfectly complying with enterprise security policies.

cta.title: The Essential Security Capsule for AI Services
cta.subtitle: The essential security layer for AI services and agents— from government compliance and data protection to trusted, scalable operations that build user confidence.

performance.title: Performance
performance.subTitle: Precise detection and efficient use that keep response quality intact after sensitive data is safeguarded.

type1Error.title: Type I Error Detection Accuracy
type1Error.description: When data that should be encapsulated is not, we test with 105 sentences containing sensitive information.

type2Error.title: Type II Error Detection Accuracy
type2Error.description: When non-sensitive data (such as general information) is incorrectly encapsulated, we test with 1,402 non-sensitive sentences.

structuredData.title: Structured Personal Data Protection
structuredData.description: Ensures 100% structured personal data protection, minimizing risks from misclassification.

responseSimilarity.title: Response Similarity with Public LLMs
responseSimilarity.description: Encapsulated data—not the original—is sent to the LLM, where responses are compared against public LLM outputs.
